data.title: Machu Picchu Weather Month to Month
data.meta_description: When is the best time to visit Machu Picchu? The weather remains moderate throughout the year, ensuring you won't experience too cold or too hot......
data.text:
We know that many of the people who travel to Machu Picchu do it for the only time; We also know that all people expect the best from this trip. We can secure your Machu Picchu tickets 2024, or if you wish, we will take care of your entire itinerary; however, only you can choose the best time to go to Machu Picchu. Why is this so important? The Inca city is 2,400 m. between the Andes Mountain Range and the Amazon Rainforest, this makes the climate of Machu Picchu very special.

Machu Picchu Peru is located between the Cordillera de Los Andes and the Amazon rainforest, and having a warm and temperate climate. In the citadel, you will never go too cold or too hot, with an average minimum temperature of 12 ° C and an average maximum temperature of 24 ° C. As it is a subtropical zone, every day of the year there is a possibility of rain, however, from April to September is the dry season and from October to March is the rainy season.

Machu Picchu Weather Month to Month

Machu Picchu Weather in January

Although January records a convenient climate, it is not the best to visit Machu Picchu. In this time the weather is humid, with an average temperature of 18 ° C and a lot of rain. If you do not mind the rain and prefer to visit the citadel without encountering too many tourists, this month may work.

January – Rainy season in Machu Picchu

Machu Picchu Weather in February

Is it a bad season to visit Machu Picchu, yes or no? For many, the least favorable time to visit Machu Picchu is during the season with the highest rainfall. While it may not be the ideal time for travel, some fortunate individuals may find it to be the best time due to the lower influx of tourists and the lush vegetation.

In February the humid and cold weather continues. The average temperature at this time of year is approximately 14 ° C. If you plan to visit Machu Picchu at this time, remember to include warm clothes. The rainy days will be present. If you want to make the Inca Trail hikes, it is disabled during February for maintenance.

Inca Trail Peru: it's under maintenance and it is closed during this month

Machu Picchu in February Weather

Machu Picchu Weather in March

In the month of March, the cold and rainy weather in Machu Picchu continues. The average temperature during this month ranges from 11 to 23 degrees Celsius (52 to 73 degrees Fahrenheit). Although it is cloudy almost all the time, during this month there is not much fog so visibility is good. Being low season, the prices of accommodations and tours can be quite cheaper than in other months.

March is characterized by decreasing rainfall and the gradual emergence of clearer skies. While occasional showers may still occur, visitors can enjoy milder weather and witness the landscape's vibrant greenery. It's an excellent time to explore Machu Picchu and its surroundings as tourist numbers begin to rise with the improving weather conditions. Travelers are advised to bring a mix of clothing, including waterproof gear for possible rain showers, as well as light layers for warmer periods. Overall, March offers a good balance between avoiding the peak tourist season and experiencing more favorable weather for outdoor exploration.

In March, the Inca Trail opens for operation, and usually, on the first day, there is a festival.

Machu Picchu weather in March marks the transition from the rainy season to the shoulder season.

Machu Picchu Weather in April

April might be the best time to visit Machu Picchu, with the ancient citadel adorned in lush flora and typically featuring sunny days with minimal rainfall.

Notoriously less humid. The maximum temperature is 21 ° C and the minimum temperature is 10 ° C. It is a very good balance between a pleasant climate and a not so cold temperature. During April the number of tourists begins to increase. The rains are more frequent in April (9 days on average per month), but if the ranks of tourists bother you, it is recommended that you go to Machu Picchu in April.

April - The best time to visit Machu Picchu begins.

Machu Picchu Weather in May

For many travelers, May is considered the best month to visit Machu Picchu and hike to the Inca Trail, as it marks the beginning of the dry season and the increase in the influx of visitors. "It is highly recommended to book your tickets in advance to avoid long lines and ensure that you will be able to visit Machu Picchu"

The month of May offers a cool and pleasant climate in Machu Picchu, ideal for visiting the Old Mountain. The maximum temperature is maintained at 20 ° C during the day. In May it is when the number of tourists increases considerably, since it coincides with the beginning of holidays in the northern hemisphere. Rains are less frequent than in April (3 days on average per month).

Machu Picchu Weather in June

June is considered the best time to visit Machu Picchu, but it's the peak season with high demand for tickets, which can sell out several months in advance.

At this time of the year the best months begin to travel to Machu Picchu. Little rain is recorded and the nights are cool. In this time is where most tourists will find around the citadel, and it is common to have to wait in line to take pictures from the most iconic points. In addition, the month of June offers a party full of color inherited from the Incas called Inti Raymi 2024. The typical costumes, dances and a lot of joy stand out during the celebration.

Machu Picchu temperature in June average ranges from 8 to 21 degrees Celsius (46 to 70 degrees Fahrenheit)

Machu Picchu Weather in July

For domestic tourists within the country, July is the best season to visit Machu Picchu, while for international tourists, it's the ideal month for trekking the Inca Trail, Salkantay, Lares, or alternative routes to the Inca citadel. During this season, the days are sunny, offering impressive views during the walks. However, it's important to note that nights can be intensely cold.

The weather conditions during the month of July in Machu Picchu remain excellent. Cool weather, with little rain and sunny days. Because the peak season is high, accommodation prices are the highest during the year and services such as the Inca Trail Tours or train tickets are sold out well in advance and we recommend reserving Machu Picchu Tickets 2024 before arriving in Cusco.

Machu Picchu temperature in July sees an average range of 6 to 19 degrees Celsius (43 to 66 degrees Fahrenheit).

Machu Picchu Weather in August

Another excellent month to have the best Machu Picchu tours is August. The weather conditions during this time are ideal for visitors. The average temperature ranges from 5 to 20 degrees Celsius (41 to 68 degrees Fahrenheit). August is one of the driest months of the year. The weather in Machu Picchu during this period presents sunny days during the day and a significant cold at dawn.

It's important to note that August is one of the peak months for tourism in Machu Picchu. While the weather is favorable, the site can get crowded. To ensure a more enjoyable experience, consider making reservations in advance for tickets, accommodations, and any guided tours.

August is considered an excellent time to visit Machu Picchu, offering pleasant weather conditions for exploration

Machu Picchu Weather in September

September is still cool, but it does not rain. Therefore, this month is also a good option to get to know Machu Picchu, so the number of tourists remains very high during the month. September is when the most notorious transition to the rainy season occurs.

September experiences a significant drop in rainfall, and visitors can expect mostly clear skies and mild temperatures. The combination of comfortable weather and the minimal presence of rain makes it an ideal time for trekking the Inca Trail or exploring Machu Picchu's archaeological wonders. The landscape is lush from the previous months' rain, providing a picturesque backdrop. September is considered a peak travel month, so it's advisable to plan and book accommodations and tickets well in advance to secure your visit to this iconic site.

Machu Picchu temperature in September exhibits an average range of 8 to 21 degrees Celsius (46 to 70 degrees Fahrenheit).

Machu Picchu Weather in October

In October, the temperature begins to drop slightly. Nevertheless, the climate remains cool and pleasant, with minimal rainfall. Towards the end of October, the high season starts to taper off, leading to reduced costs for various services, including Inca Trail hiking tours. This period is also considered one of the best times to visit Machu Picchu, as the slight increase in rainfall contributes to the Inca sanctuary becoming greener.

Machu Picchu weather in October transitions further into the dry season, providing pleasant conditions for visitors. Throughout this month, the average temperature ranges from 7 to 20 degrees Celsius (45 to 68 degrees Fahrenheit). Days are characterized by mild temperatures and clear skies, creating optimal conditions for exploring the ancient Incan citadel. With minimal rainfall, October offers excellent visibility for capturing the stunning landscapes surrounding Machu Picchu.

As the dry season progresses, the trails, including the Inca Trail, remain accessible, providing a delightful hiking experience. The lush greenery from the previous months' rains enhances the scenic beauty of the surroundings. Given its popularity among travelers, early planning and reservations are recommended to secure accommodations and tickets for a seamless and enjoyable visit to Machu Picchu.

The temperature in Machu Picchu in October presents an average range of 8 to 21 degrees Celsius (46 to 70 degrees Fahrenheit).

Machu Picchu Weather in November

In the month of November you can register a little more rain in Machu Picchu. However, the weather is nice and the temperature is not so cold.

The average temperature during this month ranges from 7 to 20 degrees Celsius (45 to 68 degrees Fahrenheit). While the weather can still be relatively dry at the beginning of the month, there's an increasing likelihood of occasional rain showers as November progresses. Visitors should be prepared for varied weather conditions, including both sunny and rainy days. The landscapes around Machu Picchu remain lush and vibrant due to the recent rains, offering a beautiful backdrop for exploration. November is considered part of the shoulder season, meaning fewer crowds compared to the peak months. Travelers are advised to bring layers, rain gear, and sturdy footwear for a comfortable and enjoyable visit to Machu Picchu in November.

This is one of the months with the lowest saturation of visitors.

Machu Picchu weather in November ushers in the transition from the dry season to the rainy season

Machu Picchu Weather in December

The climate of this time is very similar to that of November. There may be rain, but the temperature is not so cold and the weather is quite pleasant. These are the best months for those who wish to visit Machu Picchu with the least amount of tourists possible and who want to take advantage of the offers in tourist services.

The average temperature during this month ranges from 6 to 19 degrees Celsius (43 to 66 degrees Fahrenheit). December sees an increase in rainfall, and visitors can expect occasional heavy showers. Despite the rain, Machu Picchu and its surroundings remain lush and green, creating a unique and picturesque atmosphere. December falls within the shoulder season, with fewer tourists compared to the peak months. Travelers should come prepared for variable weather conditions, including rain showers and periods of sunshine. It's advisable to bring waterproof clothing, sturdy footwear, and to be mindful of the potential for slippery trails. Exploring Machu Picchu during December offers a quieter experience amid the stunning beauty of the ancient citadel.

Machu Picchu weather in December marks the onset of the rainy season, which extends into the early months of the new year.

Weather in Huayna Picchu

In general, the time in the sanctuary of Machu Picchu and in the Huayna Picchu mountain has two very marked stations:

Rainy season in Machu Picchu

It includes the months of November to March. It presents a temperate climate in the day with temperatures that oscillate between 19º and 21º C, being able to descend in the night until 8º C. There are days of enough sun and strong radiation, with temperatures that can arrive until the 20º C, nevertheless of Likewise and to a greater extent there are cloudy and rainy days, especially in the months of December and January.

The night climate is temperate with 8º C average temperature, unless it rains during the day, which could cause the temperature to drop to 0º C. If you visit during this time, it is essential to have waterproof clothing and / or umbrellas, hiking boots, that allow you to walk on slippery and wet surfaces, but also sunscreen for moments of intense radiation.

In these months we recommend you to choose the second group to Huayna Picchu with hours of entry from 10:00 to 11:00 hours, Huayna Picchu + circuit 4.

Why this group? In the rainy season the whole sanctuary usually dawn, covered with clouds so the visibility at the top is quite limited, which will prevent you from getting good panoramic views of the City of Machu Picchu. But the clouds are dissipating with the passing of the hours.

Dry season in Machu Picchu

It occurs between the months of April to October; with maximum of 21º C during the day and 10º C at night; It is a time with very sunny days and temperate air, the vegetation of the area shows its best green tone of the year, with flowers everywhere, which contributes to the abundance of insects. It is also a time of frost and cold, being more intense in the months of May and June.

Also at this time, the month of August is characterized by bringing strong winds and greater solar radiation, with 21 º C during the day and intense cold at night that drops to 0 º C. It is advisable to use sunscreen at all times, since the cold of the night also burns the skin. The presence of insects and mosquitoes is abundant on the sunniest days, so you should use repellent, sunscreen and sunglasses; essential elements to protect your skin and make your visit without discomfort.

September comes with spring, and a warm and cool climate, favorable to visit Huayna Picchu. June and July are the coldest months, with minimum temperatures of up to -2 ° C; avoid getting sick wearing warm clothes especially at night.

In case you want to ascend Huayna Picchu Mountain during this time, we recommend you choose the second group (entrance from 10:00 to 11:00).

But why this group? During the rainy season, Machu Picchu is usually covered with clouds and with little visibility, and this is not very good if you pack your best camera to take the amazing views of Machu Picchu from this mountain; nevertheless the clouds dissipate in the course of the morning.

The Best Time to visit Machu Picchu and Huayna Picchu

In our opinion, the best time to visit Machu Picchu and Huayna Picchu is at the end of April / beginning of May and the end of September / beginning of October. At the beginning of the season the vegetation green is more intense, product of the recently ended rainy season. In these dates the amount of tourists is smaller in the citadel and the trails, and the climatic conditions present in their majority days free of rain.

What to take to Machu Picchu in the dry season? (April to October)

If you plan to take a Cusco Machu Picchu tour during this time, know that the season requires visitors to bring sunscreen (hat, sunscreen, sunglasses), repellent and plenty of water. The nights are cold, so you should bring warm clothes.

What to take to Machu Picchu in the rainy season? (November to March)

If you are coming during this time do not forget to pack waterproof clothing, an umbrella and shoes that allow you to walk safely on wet and slippery surfaces.
